runs.comm: back of a length, angling away from the left-handed Amjad, who leaves it alone
wide of the crease, angling away a long way from back of a length, and Amjad leaves again
fuller now, on middle stump, and he shuffles across to work it through square leg
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, defended towards short extra cover
a touch of width there, and Berenger gets on his toes and eases that away to the right of point
beauty. That was much fuller, inviting the drive outside off but not quite pitched right up. Berenger's front foot is a little slow getting across and he has a swish and miss
length ball angling across to off stump. Amjad walks across and tucks it to short midwicket
back of a length now, nice tight line in the corridor, goes back and across and blocks to short cover
full now, a touch overpitched, and Amjad whips his wrists to take that from off stump and place it between the bowler and the diving mid-on fielder
better length now, angling away, draws Amjad forward to defend towards mid-off
once again flicked from off stump through the on side, but this time it wasn't a half-volley, and he doesn't time it particularly well, hitting across towards midwicket
a tiny bit of outswing from a fifth-stump line. Berenger leaves it alone
that's full outside off and he gets on the front foot to drive it to the left of the cover fielder, nice high left elbow
length ball on a fourth-stump line, confident stride forward to defend to short cover
lovely delivery, very full, late inswing causing Amjad's head to fall over as he misses the flick, hits him on the pad but Mooney knows that's swinging down the leg side
length ball, a bit of swing in towards off stump, defended towards short midwicket
full on off stump and it allows Amjad to play his favourite whip, I think midwicket got a hand to it diving across, slowed it down and prevented it from going to the boundary
full and wide, swings away enough for the umpire to call that wide. Berenger had no chance of playing a stroke to that
on the pads now and he tucks it away to the right of mid-on
back of a length on off stump, feet move nicely back and across to defend
oooh, that was a nice length outside off, inviting the drive, and a bit of late swing in takes the inside edge of his angled bat and just about misses off stump
back of a length outside off, gets behind it to dab it towards third man
full on off stump and Berenger shows it the full face, sends it bouncing over the leaping bowler's outstretched right arm
full outside off, opens his face on the drive, steers it to backward point
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot towards point
length ball on off stump, defended back to the bowler
length ball outside off, steps forward and gets down on one knee to flat-bat that towards extra cover
short ball, doesn't bounce as high as Amjad expects, hits him on the midriff as he rocks back to pull towards backward square leg

full and wide and that's a crunching drive from Amjad, down on one knee and flaying it with an angled bat, but it slows down alarmingly three-fourths of the way to the boundary, and the fielder running back could pull it back short of the rope. Looks a slow outfield, this.
short ball angling down leg. Keeper goes up for caught behind after Amjad misses the pull, the bowler doesn't appeal. Off the side of his stomach
length ball on off stump, gets nicely forward to block to mid-off
full and wide, another flourishing drive from Amjad but Joyce dives quickly across at cover point to stop that
back of a length on off stump, hops across to defend towards short midwicket
back of a length outside off, back and across to defend into the off side
fuller now, lots of width for Amjad to throw his flashing blade at, but again he can't quite beat Joyce
back of a length in the corridor and he jumps across to dab it down to third man
shout for lbw as this swings into Berenger as he plonks his front pad across to defend. Not the most vociferous appeal, and the umpire shakes his head. Looked to be going over the stumps
length ball outside off and he steps out of his crease to defend that to short cover
full down the leg side and Amjad can't put bat on the flick
full outside off and he shows off that high-elbowed cover drive again, didn't look to hit it too hard, just placed it wide of cover
short ball, pulls crisply down to long leg
in the blockhole outside off, jabbed down to mid-off
length ball on off stump, defended to mid-off
fullish, angling in towards off stump, blocked to short cover
invites Amjad forward but it's nowhere near driving length, and there's a bit of extra bounce and he stabs at it and edges it thickly down to third man

fullish outside off and Berenger plays a flat-batted drive, lots of bottom hand, into the gap between short cover and mid-off. Fielder slid to pull it back from the rope, touched the boundary cushions while his hand made contact
back of a length on off stump, defended to short cover
shortish outside off, gets on top of the bounce and chops it away wide of point
a bit of width but not full enough to drive. Throws his hands at the ball without moving his feet and edges it past the Kevin O'Brien, diving to his left from first slip
and again. This time it didn't quite come on as quickly as he expected and he ended up slicing it in the air down to third man
length ball on a fifth-stump line, left alone

full outside off and there isn't too much width to drive but he manufactures it, somewhat, by sliding his back foot towards the leg side and getting into a closed position, can't get it past cover point
straighter now, tucked away to short midwicket
length ball outside off, comes forward to play the checked drive to extra cover
full and wide, driven handsomely but too close to the fielder at cover point
length ball outside off, eased towards cover
tossed up, drifts in towards off stump, punched back to the bowler
a bit slower and wider and Amjad gets his foot out to drive to long-off
tossed up outside off, driven to extra cover
quicker, angled into off and middle, and Berenger defends into the on side
low full-toss outside off, driven straight to mid-off
full on off stump, driven to extra cover
starts the over with a bouncer, Amjad gets into a semi-crouch to evade it
shortish, angling away from Amjad and swinging away a touch, throws his bat at it away from his body but can't connect
fuller now, and Amjad leaves it alone outside off
back of a length outside off, shuffles across to bunt it down to short cover
full and wide, driven to sweeper cover
full on off stump, driven firmly but straight to the bowler
length ball on off stump, plants his front foot across and whips it away over backward square. Drops down to the left of long leg
length ball angling in towards off, Amjad presses forward to defend
here's the reverse-sweep, hits it firmly from an off-stump line, can't beat the man at short third man diving to his right
oh my. This has been a bit of a struggle for Berenger, and it ends tamely, as he pops up a back of a length ball, leg-stumpish, straight into short midwicket's hands, going too early into a flick
back of a length outside off, goes back and across to defend
lovely delivery, quick-arm action, goes through with the arm from a good length outside off. Chandran is beaten playing for turn
length ball on off stump, Chandran stays in his crease, looks to play into the on side, closes his face a touch early and it rolls off the leading edge into the off side
short outside off, sat up at waist height and Amjad swivels to pull it away easily to the midwicket boundary
length ball outside off, gets forward and dabs it down to backward point
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, shuffles across and defends back to the bowler
fullish outside off, and that's a shot halfway between a drive and a whip to short extra cover, big roll of the wrists there
length ball outside off and he throws his bat through a wavy arc to steer that through point and doesn't make contact
back of a length outside off, defended into the off side

got him! Again it's the one that goes with the angle. It's angled in towards off stump and he drives at it with an angled bat, too much bottom hand in that, and it pops up off the outside edge and it goes very quickly to Kevin O'Brien at slip, over his right shoulder, and he parried it in the air at the first attempt and caught it safely on the second attempt
lovely length, angling in towards off stump, driven to short cover
nice flight, a bit of drift in towards off stump, driven back to the bowler
length ball on off stump, gets nicely forward, front pad out of the way, to defend
tossed up outside off, another good stride out to defend into the off side

pushed through quicker on the stumps, and he looks to flick but that's through him quickly with some extra bounce and pops up in the air towards the keeper, who makes a polite appeal for caught behind. No bat on that for sure
low full-toss outside off, driven to short extra cover
full outside off, driven straight to cover
on the pads now and it's tucked away neatly through backward square leg
fullish, a bit of swing in towards off stump. Amjad comes forward to defend
length ball outside off, blocked into the covers. Again there was a tiny bit of shape in and it went off the inside half of his bat
fuller now, driven to mid-off
length ball, angling in towards off stump, driven to mid-off
fuller now, a bit slower through the air, defended carefully back to the bowler
a bit more air now and he's down the track but he can't get to the pitch, goes with the angle and forces him to block it back to the bowler

goes for the reverse-sweep and that's way too full to be playing that shot. Did he inside-edge that onto his pads? No review from Ireland for the rejected lbw appeal, and yes, he edged it into his pad and it popped up in the air behind the stumps
for the first time Stirling overpitches one with just a bit of width, and Khurram puts the drive away confidently to the cover boundary
quicker now, pulls his length back a bit and slants it in towards off stump. Khurram is hurried into a defensive push into the off side
full outside off, driven to mid-off
shortish outside off, can't really time the pull, drags it down to mid-on
short outside off, he bent his back on that one and Khurram had to jump in the air to get on top of the bounce and chop it down to third man
slower ball outside off and he comes forward and has to wait for it to come on and all he can do is dab it a short distance into the off side
down the track and he bangs it short, pulled away to deep square leg

uh oh. Bad choice of shot, playing across a fullish ball angling in at the stumps, and he's hit on the front pad, but the umpire says not out. He may have shuffled across enough to get hit outside the line. Ireland don't review this
length ball, flat, angling in towards off, no turn. Amjad defends from within his crease
now he goes for the sweep from an off-stump line, rolls his wrists to play that down to deep backward square leg
fuller now, and some width outside off, driven to the left of sweeper cover
full on middle and leg, clipped away to the left of short midwicket
nice flight with an angle towards off stump, again there's no turn and he defends watchfully off the front foot
a bit slower and straighter, Khurram looks to clip it away through the leg side and it goes with the arm and hits him on the front pad
short, down the leg side at a gentle pace. Amjad swivels round and helps it down to the fine leg boundary
length ball on a fourth-stump line, blocked towards short extra cover
back of a length outside off, no pace on it at all. Amjad waits and waits and squirts it down towards short third man
back of a length on off stump, defended towards short midwicket
short, sits up, he could have hit that anywhere he wanted, but all he manages to do is pick out Sorensen on the deep square leg boundary
back of a length on off stump, blocked into the off side off the back foot
length ball outside off, shuffles across to defend into the off side
lovely flight outside off, invites the drive, beats him with dip and lack of turn
flatter and quicker outside off and he goes back and across to tuck it towards midwicket
flighted again, closer to off stump, pushed back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, steered away to deep point
length ball angling in towards off. Khurram steps back and makes room to slap it to sweeper cover
back of a length on off and middle, lets it come on and dabs it away to third man
back of a length outside off, punched to short cover
fullish outside off and he presses forward to steer it down to third man
shortish on middle stump, pulled round to deep square leg
gone! Back of a length outside off, a bit of extra bounce, and he pushes hard at it with an angled bat and gets a thick edge that goes to slip just above head height
length ball on off stump, blocked into the covers, no real footwork there
length ball angling in towards off stump, presses forward to defend
rare bad ball from Stirling, pushes it through and slips down the leg side
loopy outside off, flat-batted to point
tossed up outside off, driven to extra cover
length ball, angling in and cramping Khurram for room, slapped to point on one knee
again that angle into off stump, no turn, comes forward to defend into the off side
drifts into the pads now, clipped to deep square leg
length ball outside off, guided down to third man
slower ball on off stump, defended back towards the bowler
back of a length outside off, simply doesn't come on for the punch, ends up hitting it early, down to mid-off
slower ball angling into middle and off, clipped to short midwicket
shot! That wasn't really short enough to punch but he simply stands tall and hammers it through extra cover, slows down as it nears the boundary, would have been four on most outfields
short, another uppish pull, but he picked his spot well, hitting it square enough to beat the long leg fielder comfortably
shortish outside off, punched to sweeper cover
length ball, angling in towards middle and leg, goes on the back foot to defend towards midwicket
back of a length on off stump, no room to force it past the man at cover
length ball on off stump, punched hard but straight back to the bowler
slides down the leg side and Khurram misses out there, sweeps it straight to short fine leg
quicker now, angling down leg again. Khurram has to play around his front foot to work that into the on side, doesn't make contact, and it hits him on the side of the pad
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
slower ball wide outside off, reaches out and slaps it uppishly but into the gap through backward point
slower ball angling towards off stump. Bowled it with a legcutter action and it straightened just a touch as Khurram came forward to defend. Beat his inside edge and hit him on the pad
short ball, takes ages to get to Khurram, pulled down to long leg
another slower ball outside off, defended to short extra cover
back of a length outside off, punched away to sweeper cover
tossed up outside off, slapped away to sweeper cover
looks to sweep from outside off, goes with the angle and thuds into his front pad, which had been thrust a long way outside the line
flatter, round-arm, shortish with some width, can only chop it to backward point
full on leg stump, looks to clip to mid-on and short midwicket dives to intercept
length ball, rocks back and punches it from an off-stump line towards the sweeper
flat, back of a length, angling in towards middle and leg, clips it straight to square leg
fullish, angling away from off stump, steered away towards sweeper cover
length ball outside off, driven crisply on the up to the right of sweeper cover
back of a length, a bit of shape in towards off stump, defended to short cover
back of a length once more, a bit more bounce and he gets on top of it to dab it to backward point
a bit more width and he punches it firmly into the ground, bounces over backward point and goes quickly to the right of third man, who has to slide to stop it at the boundary
a little closer to off stump, punched off the back foot through cover
length ball outside off, punched away to sweeper cover
down the track, checked drive to long-off
flat and quick outside off and he gets his front foot across to use the pace and lap it away towards fine leg
a bit of flight, angling in towards off stump, comes forward and pokes it gently to the right of the short cover fielder
back of a length outside off, cut away towards deep point
length ball on off stump, defended off the front foot into the covers, finishes with brilliant figures of 2 for 27 from 10 overs
back of a length on off stump, eased into the covers
length ball on middle stump, poked back to the bowler
back of a length on middle and off, gets up on his toes to defend into the off side
fullish on middle and leg, tucked away to the left of mid-on
full and wide, driven to sweeper cover
back of a length on middle stump, hops across to work it away to deep square leg
length ball on off stump, skips away and punches it to sweeper cover
flat, angling into the pads, tucked away through square leg
back of a length, turns in towards leg and tucks up Khurram, who is backing away to make room. Manages to squeeze it away to deep point
tossed up full on leg stump, driven down to long-on
a bit round-arm, angling in towards off and middle, lets it come on and dabs it to short third man
tossed up on off stump, whipped away to deep midwicket
length ball angling across Khurram, who leans away from the line and forces it to deep cover
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, defended to short cover
ooh. He was looking to work that away from off stump through midwicket, and it came in just a touch and beat his inside edge and passed over the stumps
a touch short and Shaiman smacks it down the ground, shovelling deliberately under the ball to get it over mid-on
too early into this pull after Cusack bowls the slower bouncer, hits him on the back of his bat and rolls into the off side
back of a length on off stump, dabbed to the left of point
short outside off, stopped on the pitch, and he was too early into that slap and hit it straight to short extra cover
back of a length, angling into the pads, worked away through square leg
sees him coming down the track and bowls it straighter, and he times the drive very well down the ground, long-on has to slide to his right to stop that

big appeal for lbw and it's given! Came outside his crease and looked to work it leg side, and it hurried through to hit his front pad. Khurram has reviewed... he was a long way down the track. Let's seen now, not much turn, seemed to hit him in line with off stump, going on to clip the top of leg stump, which means it's umpire's call. Khurram's a little unlucky there, simply because it was the sort of lbw call that looked a little not-out at first sight, simply because of how far he was down the pitch.
tossed up outside off, presses forward and steers it towards backward point
length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
short, rising ball angling into the body, jumps up and plays a controlled pull to deep square leg
length ball in the corridor, left alone
a little closer to off stump and he has a poke at it, looking towards third man. Ball straightens and beats his outside edge
fullish, angling in towards off stump, driven down to mid-off
a bit of width outside off, not full enough to drive, goes at it with an angled bat and is beaten again
very full outside off and he goes for another drive, slices it off the outside half of the bat down to third man
tossed up, angling in towards off stump, presses forward to defend into the off side
full, angling in towards middle and leg, comes forward to defend and it goes with the angle and hits the inside of his bat
looks to pull this shortish ball, connects well but can't beat short fine leg
back of a length on off stump, poked away to point
slips down the leg side now, Shaiman can't connect with the sweep
back of a length on off stump, chopped away towards deep point
back of a length outside off, steered to backward point
short slower ball, pulled round to long leg
got him! Cusack bends his back a bit more and gets this to lift from back of a length. Not much room to cut anyway, and he gets a thick edge through to the keeper
length ball angling in towards off stump, defended back to the bowler
slower short ball outside off, Javed leaves it for the keeper
length ball angling in from wide of the crease. Plonks his front pad across and defends into the on side
short ball, comes in off the track with some bounce. Javed leans away from the line
length ball angling in towards middle and off. Shaiman makes room to slap it away through the covers
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
a bit more flight, angled into middle and leg, blocked back to the bowler
nice loop, drops onto a nice length on off stump and straightens, defended into the covers
a bit quicker outside off and he comes forward to poke it wide of point
short ball, and he's quickly on the back foot and opens up to pull it to the square leg boundary
back of a length on off stump, goes on the back foot and nudges it with the angle through square leg
full outside off and that's driven with a straight bat through the gap between short cover and mid-off
another of those slower bouncers, angling in towards the batsman, who leans his upper body out of the way
again, a slower bouncer allowed to loop through to the keeper
again, and this time it bounces up well over head height and the umpire signals wide
back of a length on off stump and he makes room to slap it away over point
full, a lot of width, and he climbs into a crisp drive through extra cover, slows down just short of the boundary, allowing Dockrell to pull it back with a tumble
back of a length, angling into the pads, nudged away towards short fine leg
pushed through a bit quicker and fuller, and he's cramped for room as he goes back to punch, can only push it back to the bowler
length ball on off stump, looks for the dabbed single to short third man, but the fielder comes in quickly and prevents it
flat, angled in towards middle stump. Shaiman is on the back foot to punch it back to the bowler
a little slower  but flat again, no room and he can only defend to short cover
full on middle and leg, clipped away to the right of short midwicket
shortish, sits up, Anwar clears his front leg and swivels through a powerful pull over midwicket
back of a length outside off, lets it come on and dabs it away to third man
slips down leg side, shortish, and Javed goes deep in his crease and whips it over short fine leg, that is a super shot against a frankly terrible delivery
slower ball outside off, a touch too short, and he backs away and makes room to carve that away over cover point. This isn't very good bowling
looks to bang this one in and it gets up to chest height, angling into the batsman. He makes room and calmly guides it to third man
slower short ball outside off, shuffles across and pulls it away to deep backward square leg
length ball, angling in towards off stump. Presses forward and pushes it just wide of short cover
short, a bit of width, cut away to the right of point
short again, and Javed exposes all his stumps to slap that away over cover
short again, outside off, and this time Shaiman properly punishes Dockrell, rocking back and pulling with quick hands high over the straight midwicket boundary
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
low full-toss on middle and leg, punched back to the bowler
extremely wide of the crease, angles it in towards off stump on a full length. Amjad uses the angle to play a super pick-up shot, flicking it away to the backward square leg boundary
slower ball, full and wide, timed crisply but hit in the air, bounces down to long-off
slower bouncer, Shaiman plays a controlled pull, rolling his wrists over at the top of the bounce, rolls through forward square leg to bring up an excellent half-century
slower ball outside off, looks to make room to slice it towards third man, can't beat backward point
another slower bouncer, goes way over Shaiman's head as he looks to go back and across and pull
full on off stump, clears his front leg and scoops it inside-out over extra cover, another terrific shot from Shaiman
another slower bouncer and he gets across to pull it to deep square leg. It's the third bouncer of the over, and it's a no-ball for height
slower ball again, but this one's much fuller and on middle stump. He backs away to drive but can't beat short cover
back of a length on off stump, chopped to backward point
floats this up high, drops onto a very full length on leg stump. Shaiman makes room and can't drill that past the diving short extra cover fielder
not short enough to pull, hit straight to short midwicket
down the track now, gets inside the line, and that's a wonderful lofted drive, inside-out, and he bisects sweeper cover and long-off
length ball on leg stump, saw him trying to make room. Ends up clipping this to mid-on
short, and he's immediately deep in his crease to slug that over the non-striker, tennis-style, and beat long-on running to his left
short ball, angling into off and middle. Javed makes room and carves it away wide of short third man
fuller now, on middle stump, and he takes a big step back and across and nurdles it into the square leg region
sees him make room and follows him with a short ball, manages to pull it away to the right of long-on
rolls his fingers over that length ball on off stump and he walks across and calmly laps it away to the fine leg boundary
another short ball, clears his front leg and clubs it down to long-on
back of a length slower ball on leg stump, tucked away through backward square leg
full-toss outside off and that's a poor ball with mid-off in the circle. Shaiman clears his front leg and scoops that down the ground, to the left of that fielder, one bounce and over the rope
and he still puts it away in the gap to the left of deep square leg, as he bangs this short and he meets it with a crunching pull
fuller now, on middle and leg, clipped down to long-on
another slower bouncer, and Javed hunches his shoulders to get under it
in the blockhole on off and middle, makes room to hit that inside-out to sweeper cover
slower ball, full and wide, slapped away to sweeper cover
short outside off, pulled away to deep midwicket
low full-toss, angling into the pads of the batsman as he backs away, quick hands to whip it down to long leg
slower ball on off and middle and he shuffles across to clip it through the vacant square leg region and pick up two. Clever batting, this
on the pads and it's glanced down to fine leg
bouncer, Javed ducks under it
short outside off, angling in. Javed leans away and dabs it to short third man
sees him make room and bowls it wide of off stump, ends up bowling it too wide, well beyond the tramline
slower ball, short and wide, slapped away towards deep point
full outside off and Javed can't connect, he was backing away and had to throw his bat at it away from his body
this time he stays still as he bowls it short and wide, carves it in the air towards deep point
again, sees the batsman moving around in his crease and goes full and wide, ends up bowling a wide outside off stump
and again. It would have been a wide had Shaiman stayed where he was. Instead he moved across to try and cut it, couldn't make contact
short and wide again and he slices it over the top, bounces down towards deep point
slower bouncer outside off, pulled towards mid-on
short ball, and he hits it well but too close to Joyce, who moves to his right from deep midwicket and takes a well-judged catch
another short ball, and this time he gets on top of the bounce and keeps it down, and also finds the gap wide of deep midwicket. What a start for Mohammad Naveed!
yorker on middle and leg, clipped towards short midwicket
slower ball, back of a length, angling in towards leg stump, following the batsman, who punches it away through the covers
another slower bouncer, and he didn't time that attempted flat-bat hit down the ground, ended up scooping it high, but managed to put it in the gap to the right of mid-off
low full-toss on the pads, clipped to long-on
this is getting predictable, sees him back away and bowls it wide outside off, ends up overdoing it

this is hilarious. Shaiman jumped across his stumps even before O'Brien was halfway into his run-up, and had exposed all of his stumps. O'Brien followed him and he looked to whip it away through midwicket, got a thick outside edge that flew to the third man boundary
short outside off and Super Shaiman stands still and pulls it away authoritatively to the straight midwicket boundary. Take that!
full and very wide, and he has to walk back to his mark and bowl that ball all over again... ideally not that ball.
slower ball outside off, quite full, and he slices under the attempted drive and hits it towards deep backward point

back of a length outside off and is that the hundred? Yes it is! Brilliant stuff, and that's a brilliant bit of batting to get to the landmark, dabbing it away into the gap to the left of short third man and picking up three. Takes the helmet off and sinks to his knees, huge grin on his face. This has been a wonderful innings.
short ball over leg stump as he backs away from the stumps. Looks to pull, toe-ends it to the right of the keeper
now he goes the other way, full and angling down leg. Shaiman clips it away in the air, to the left of the fielder at short fine leg
short ball, angling into the body. Stands on his toes and pulls it to deep midwicket
full on middle and leg, makes room to drive to mid-off
slower ball, just misses leg stump after the batsman gives himself room and swings and misses

goes a long way outside leg stump and Sorensen bowls a simple length ball on off stump. He has to reach for it to hit that over the covers, ends up scooping it high in the air behind the wicket off the outside half of his bat. The wicketkeeper settles under it, and that's the end of a fantastic World Cup century
shortish outside off, makes room and flat-bats it to mid-off
back of a length on off stump, back and across and defends back to the bowler. Was probably looking for a single to mid-off
back of a length slower ball outside off. Naveed moves around - first to his right, then to his left - and swings and misses
another slower ball outside off, wider and fuller, and he scoops it down to long-off
that's an incredible shot! It's a length ball, angling in towards leg stump, and he's exposed all his stumps and played a late-cut into the gap to short third man's left
now the yorker outside off and Naveed has to reach out for it, goes under his bat as he jams down on it
short ball, into the body as he backs away. Goes for the pull, top-edges it high in the air, and the bowler takes a simple catch, goes for the hands-over-head technique
back of a length outside off. Tauqir clubs it down to long-on and they run two to finish on 278
